COMMAND.name: md5sum
COMMAND.ACTION:
udisk="udisk:" cmd="md5sum "
showname="${GFILENAME}" cmdname="${GFILENAME}" accessname=`fnconvert -p "$showname" -c accessname 2>/dev/null` if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then echo "% Invalid file name" exit 1 fi
if ! [ -f $accessname ]; then echo "% Please specify regular file" exit fi
cmd=$cmd" $accessname"
if [[ $cmdname == $udisk* ]] then result=`$cmd | sed -e 's/\/mnt\/udisk\//udisk:\//'` else result=`$cmd | sed -e 's/\/mnt\/flash\//flash:\//'` fi # added by tongzb for bug 54393,2019-11-15 echo 3 > /proc/sys/vm/drop_caches echo $result
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To calculate file MD5sum, use the show version command in EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command can calculate file MD5sum.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to calculate file MD5sum. Centec# md5 flash:/syslog ecd62b2ab1703e77e398ab18e347735d flash:/syslog

COMMAND.name: sha512sum
COMMAND.ACTION:
udisk="udisk:" cmd="sha512sum "
showname="${GFILENAME}" cmdname="${GFILENAME}" accessname=`fnconvert -p "$showname" -c accessname 2>/dev/null` if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then echo "% Invalid file name" exit 1 fi
if ! [ -f $accessname ]; then echo "% Please specify regular file" exit fi
cmd=$cmd" $accessname"
if [[ $cmdname == $udisk* ]]; then result=`$cmd | sed -e 's/\/mnt\/udisk\//udisk:\//'` else result=`$cmd | sed -e 's/\/mnt\/flash\//flash:\//'` fi
if test -z "$result"; then usleep 1 else echo "$result" | awk '{split($0, str, "[ ]"); print str[1]}' fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To calculate file sha512sum, use the show version command in EXEC mode.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command can calculate file sha512sum.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to calculate file sha512sum. Centec# sha512sum flash:/syslog ecd62b2ab1703e77e398ab18e347735decd62b2ab1703e77e398ab18e347735decd62b2ab1703e77e398ab18e347735d

COMMAND.name: show environment
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the hardware environment information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command only can show the hardware environment information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display hardware environment information. Switch# show environment Fan tray status: Index Status 1 PRESENT FanIndex Status SpeedRate Mode --------+------+---------+----- 1-1 OK 40% Auto 1-2 OK 40% Auto 1-3 OK 40% Auto 1-4 OK 40% Auto --------------------------------------------------------- Power status: Index Status Power Type Alert -----+---------+-------+-------+------- 1 PRESENT OK AC NO 2 PRESENT FAIL - ALERT --------------------------------------------------------- Sensor status (Degree Centigrade): Index Temperature Lower_alarm Upper_alarm Critical_limit Position -----+-----------+-----------+-----------+--------------+---------- 1 38 5 65 80 AROUND_CHIP 2 40 5 65 80 AROUND_CHIP 3 31 5 65 80 AROUND_FAN 4 35 5 65 80 AROUND_CPU 5 60 -10 100 110 SWITCH_CHIP

COMMAND.name: show psu-pmbus-info
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the psu pmbus information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command only can show the psu pmbus information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display psu pmbus information. Switch# show psu-pmbus-info Psu 0: status_byte: 0x00 status_word: 0x0000 status_vout: 0x00 status_iout: 0x00 status_input: 0x00 status_temperature: 0x00 status_cml: 0x02 status_other: 0x55 status_mfr_specific: 0x00 status_fans_1_2: 0x00 status_fans_3_4: 0xb1 Psu 1: status_byte: 0x08 status_word: 0x0008 status_vout: 0x00 status_iout: 0x00 status_input: 0x08 status_temperature: 0x00 status_cml: 0x02 status_other: 0x00 status_mfr_specific: 0x00 status_fans_1_2: 0x00 status_fans_3_4: 0xb3

COMMAND.name: show vcm-info
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the vcm information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command only can show the vcm information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to display vcm information. Switch# show vcm-info Module_no Pin_name value Lower_alarm Upper_alarm Units 1-1 BMR464_OUT_VOLT 0.8700 0.7650 0.9350 V 1-2 BMR464_IN_VOLT 11.7812 10.8000 13.2000 V 1-3 BMR464_OUT_CURR 11.7188 1.0000 1000.0000 A 1-4 BMR464_TMPR 42.9375 -20.0000 92.0000 C
2-1 BMR464_OUT_VOLT 0.8700 0.7650 0.9350 V 2-2 BMR464_IN_VOLT 11.7656 10.8000 13.2000 V 2-3 BMR464_OUT_CURR 11.9688 1.0000 1000.0000 A 2-4 BMR464_TMPR 40.6875 -20.0000 92.0000 C

COMMAND.name: show clock
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the clock information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The show clock command can get the clock information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display clock information. Switch# show clock 14:19:53 UTC Wed Sep 16 2015

COMMAND.name: show transceiver
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the transceiver information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to show the interface transceiver information,or the transceiver detail information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to display transceiver information. Switch# show transceiver detail
Port eth-0-49/1 transceiver info: Transceiver Type: 40GBASE_CR4 Transceiver Vendor Name : ATOP Transceiver PN : APCP04-QSC030-28 Transceiver S/N : CP04Q50100010 Transceiver Output Wavelength: N/A Supported Link Type and Length: Link Length for copper: 3 m Digital diagnostic is not implemented.
Port eth-0-49/2 transceiver info: Transceiver Type: 40GBASE_CR4 Transceiver Vendor Name : ATOP Transceiver PN : APCP04-QSC030-28 Transceiver S/N : CP04Q50100010 Transceiver Output Wavelength: N/A Supported Link Type and Length: Link Length for copper: 3 m Digital diagnostic is not implemented.
Port eth-0-49/3 transceiver info: Transceiver Type: 40GBASE_CR4 Transceiver Vendor Name : ATOP Transceiver PN : APCP04-QSC030-28 Transceiver S/N : CP04Q50100010 Transceiver Output Wavelength: N/A Supported Link Type and Length: Link Length for copper: 3 m Digital diagnostic is not implemented.
Port eth-0-49/4 transceiver info: Transceiver Type: 40GBASE_CR4 Transceiver Vendor Name : ATOP Transceiver PN : APCP04-QSC030-28 Transceiver S/N : CP04Q50100010 Transceiver Output Wavelength: N/A Supported Link Type and Length: Link Length for copper: 3 m Digital diagnostic is not implemented.

COMMAND.name: show system summary
COMMAND.ACTION: echo "########## Version Table ##########" cdbctl show/cdb/sys/version echo "########## Management IP Table ##########" cdbctl show/cdb/sys/manage_if/ipv4 cdbctl show/cdb/sys/manage_if/ipv6 echo "########## Route Mac Table ##########" cdbctl show/cdb/sys/sys_global/routemac echo "########## Users Table ##########" cdbctl show/cdb/app/login echo "########## Memory Summary Table ##########" cdbctl show/cdb/sys/mem_summary
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the summary of system information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command to show the summary of system information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE:
This example shows how to display the summary of system information. Switch# show system summary ########## Version Table ########## CNOS Software, E580, Version 0.0.0.15.it Copyright (C) 2004-2015 Centec Networks Inc. All rights reserved. The current running image is: flash:/boot/sai-v580-v1.0.0.3.it.d.bin
Switch uptime is 0 days, 5 hours, 0 minutes Hardware Type : 48X6Q SDRAM size : 1024M Flash size : 2048M Hardware Version : 2.0 EPLD Version : 2.2 BootRom Version : ONIE-master-201505061800 System serial number : E140GD15800C ########## Management IP Table ########## Management IP address: 10.10.33.225/24 Gateway: 10.10.33.254 ########## Route Mac Table ########## Route MAC is: 001e.080a.ace5 ########## Users Table ########## Line User Host(s) Idle Location 130 vty 0 idle 00:32:19 10.10.22.235 *131 vty 1 idle 00:00:03 10.10.25.29 ########## Memory Summary Table ########## Total memory : 1005816 KB Used memory : 292156 KB Freed memory : 713660 KB Buffer memory : 0 KB Cached memory : 146628 KB Memory utilization: 29.05%

COMMAND.name: show reboot-info
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show reboot information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to show reboot information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to display reboot information: Switch# show reboot-info Times Reboot Type Reboot Time 1 MANUAL 2015-09-14 17:32:14 2 MANUAL 2015-09-14 19:35:20 3 MANUAL 2015-09-14 19:41:03 4 MANUAL 2015-09-14 20:18:36 5 MANUAL 2015-09-14 21:35:11 6 MANUAL 2015-09-14 21:44:30 7 MANUAL 2015-09-15 11:19:15 8 MANUAL 2015-09-15 19:30:40 9 MANUAL 2015-09-15 20:40:39 10 MANUAL 2015-09-16 09:23:39

COMMAND.name: clear reboot-info
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to clear reboot information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The clear reboot-info command can clear reboot information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to clear reboot information: Switch# clear reboot-info

COMMAND.name: set device id-led
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set device indicate led force on or force off.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The command can set device indicate led force on or force off.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to set device indicate led force on: Switch# set device id-led on

COMMAND.name: show device id-led
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show device indicate led information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to show device indicate led information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows the device indicate led information: Switch# show device id-led Indicate led is forced on

COMMAND.name: show diagnostic bootup level
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show diagnostic bootup level.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to show diagnostic bootup level.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to show diagnostic bootup level: Switch# show diagnostic bootup level

COMMAND.name: show diagnostic bootup result
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ ! -e /tmp/.bootup_diag_log ]; then echo "% The board didn't do bootup diag!" else cat /tmp/.bootup_diag_log fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show diagnostic bootup result.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to show diagnostic bootup result.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to show diagnostic bootup result: Switch# show diagnostic bootup result

COMMAND.name: show schedule reboot
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show schedule reboot information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Use this command to show schedule reboot information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows schedule reboot information: Switch# show schedule reboot Current time is : 2016-06-02 01:22:42 Will reboot at : 2016-06-02 02:42:42

COMMAND.name: show poe summary
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the poe summary information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command only can show the poe summary information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display poe summary information. Switch# show poe summary DUT1# show poe summary ------------------------------------------------- Power Source Equipment NO: 1 Power Limit: 1612 W Power Available: 1609 W Power Actual Consump: 3 W Operation status: enable Channel Num for power: 24 ------------------------------------------------- Power Source Equipment NO: 2 Power Limit: 1612 W Power Available: 1609 W Power Actual Consump: 3 W Operation status: enable Channel Num for power: 24

COMMAND.name: show poe status all
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the poe status information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command only can show the poe status information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display poe status information. DUT1# show poe status all Codes : CH - channel IF - interface ST - enable status MD - mode CL - class PR - priority V - voltage(V) mA - current(mA) TP - temperature('C) LM - power limit(W) CS - consumption(W) AP - available power(W) DIS - disable EN - enable CR - critical HI - high LO - low ------+----------+----+----+----+---+---+------+------+---+------+------+------ CH IF ST OP MD CL PR V mA TP LM CS AP 1-1 eth-0-25 EN OFF AT -- LO 0.0 0 75 36.0 0.0 35.1 1-2 eth-0-26 EN OFF AT -- LO 0.0 0 75 36.0 0.0 35.8 1-3 eth-0-27 EN OFF AT -- LO 0.0 0 75 36.0 0.0 35.8

COMMAND.name: show poe status interface
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to show the poe status information.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: This command only can show the poe status information.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to display poe status information. DUT1# show poe status interface eth-0-29 ------------------------------------------------- Power Source Equipment NO: 1 Power Limit: 1612 W Power Available: 1609 W Power Actual Consump: 3 W Operation status: enable Channel Num for power: 24 ------------------------------------------------- Power Channel: 5 Interface Name: eth-0-29 Status: enable Power Operation: ON Power Mode: AT Power Class: 0 Power Priority: low Voltage: 56.0 V Current: 45 mA Temperature: 71 C Power limit: 36.0 W Power Consump: 2.4 W Power available: 33.6 W

COMMAND.name: temperature
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the system temperature monitor threshold.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The unit for temperature is centigrade. The critical temperature must higher than high temperature 5 Celsius degrees. The high temperature must higher than low temperature 5 Celsius degrees.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default threshold is low temperature 5, high temperature 65, and critical temperature 80.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to specify the temperature thresholds: Switch# configure terminal Switch(config)# temperature 5 70 80

COMMAND.name: no temperature
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the system temperature monitor threshold to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The unit for temperature is centigrade. The critical temperature must higher than high temperature 5 Celsius degrees. The high temperature must higher than low temperature 5 Celsius degrees.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default threshold is low temperature 5, high temperature 65, and critical temperature 80.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to specify the temperature thresholds to default value: Switch# configure terminal Switch(config)# no temperature

COMMAND.name: fan
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the system fan speed.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The unit for speed is percentage. The full speed must no less than high speed. The high speed must no less than low speed. The low speed must no less than bottom speed. The speed must step with 10.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default speed is bottom 40% low 60%, high 80%, and full 100%.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to specify the fan speed: Switch# configure terminal Switch(config)# fan 30 60 90 100

COMMAND.name: no fan
COMMAND.help: Set default fan speed rate configuration
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the system fan speed to default value.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The unit for speed is percentage. The full speed must no less than high speed. The high speed must no less than low speed. The low speed must no less than bottom speed. The speed must step with 10.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default speed is bottom 40% low 60%, high 80%, and full 100%.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to specify the fan speed: Switch# configure terminal Switch(config)# no fan speed-rate

COMMAND.name: diagnostic
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the system bootup diag level.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to specify the system bootup diag level. Switch# configure terminal Switch(config)# diagnostic bootup level minimal

COMMAND.name: no diagnostic
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: To specify the system bootup diag level to default.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to specify the system bootup diag level to default. Switch# configure terminal Switch(config)# no diagnostic bootup level

COMMAND.name: clock set datetime
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set system current date and time on the Switch.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: If no other source of time is available, you can manually configure the time and date after the system is restarted. The time remains accurate until the next system restart. We recommend that you use manual configuration only as a last resort. If you have an outside source to which the switch can synchronize, you do not need to manually set the system clock.
COMMAND.CTCDEFAULT: The default time is based from UTC.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to manually set the system clock to 1:32 p.m. on September 23, 2015: Switch(config)# clock set 13:32:00 23 9 2015

COMMAND.name: clock set summer-time

PARAM.name: name
PARAM.help: summer-time name, must be less than 32 characters(A-Za-z).Its length range is [3,31]

PARAM.help: Positive time zone offset from UTC

PARAM.name: minus
PARAM.help: Negative time zone offset from UTC

PARAM.name: hours
PARAM.help: Hours offset from UTC, must be range 0~23

PARAM.name: minutes
PARAM.help: Minutes offset from UTC, must be range 0~59

PARAM.name: seconds
PARAM.help: Seconds offset from UTC, must be range 0~59

COMMAND.name: install
COMMAND.ACTION:
showname="${GFILENAME}" accessname=`fnconvert -p "$showname" -c accessname 2>/dev/null` if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then echo "% Invalid file name" exit 1 fi
if ! [ -f $accessname ]; then echo "% Please specify regular file" exit fi
chmod +x $accessname $accessname
if ! [ -f /tmp/glb_install_debian_done ]; then echo "Install debian filesystem failed, please restart system and try again." else echo "Debian system has been installed, but cannot take effect until the next reload with debian image." fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to install debian filesystem.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to install debian filesystem: Switch(config)# install debian flash:/debian-installer

COMMAND.name: update epld
COMMAND.ACTION:
showname="${GFILENAME}" accessname=`fnconvert -p "$showname" -c accessname 2>/dev/null` if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then echo "% Invalid file name" exit 1 fi
if ! [ -f $accessname ]; then echo "% Please specify regular file" exit fi
cdbctl update/cdb/sys/bhm_global/hw_watchdog_enable/0 cdbctl update/cdb/sys/update_epld/${GFILENAME}
UPDATE_EPLD_MAX_TIME_SEC=80 CNT=0 while [ $CNT -lt $UPDATE_EPLD_MAX_TIME_SEC ]; do if [ -f /tmp/glb_update_epld_done ] ; then break; else CNT=`expr $CNT + 1` fi sleep 1; done
if [ $CNT -eq $UPDATE_EPLD_MAX_TIME_SEC ] ; then echo "Update EPLD failed" else cdbctl update/cdb/sys/bhm_global/hw_watchdog_enable/1 echo "Please power off and then power on the switch right now!" fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to upgrade system EPLD image.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to update EPLD image: Switch(config)# update epld flash:/boot/vme_v1.0

COMMAND.name: update bootrom
COMMAND.ACTION:
showname="${GFILENAME}" accessname=`fnconvert -p "$showname" -c accessname 2>/dev/null` if [ "$?" != "0" ] ; then echo "% Invalid file name" exit 1 fi
if ! [ -f $accessname ]; then echo "% Please specify regular file" exit fi
cdbctl update/cdb/sys/update_bootrom/${GFILENAME}
UPDATE_UBOOT_MAX_TIME_SEC=20 CNT=0 while [ $CNT -lt $UPDATE_UBOOT_MAX_TIME_SEC ]; do if [ -f /tmp/glb_update_bootrom_done ] ; then break; else CNT=`expr $CNT + 1` fi sleep 1; done
if [ $CNT -eq $UPDATE_UBOOT_MAX_TIME_SEC ] ; then echo "Update bootrom failed" else echo "Update bootrom successfully, new bootrom will take effect after reboot." fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to upgrade bootrom image.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to update bootrom image: Switch(config)# update bootrom flash:/boot/bootrom.bin

COMMAND.name: load-phy

PARAM.name: GFILENAME
PARAM.help: check for check version, others for firmware name

COMMAND.ACTION:
if [ ${GFILENAME} == "check" ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/sys/update_phy_firmware/${GPORTID}/check_version else if [ ! -f ${GFILENAME} ]; then echo "Update PHY firmware failed: no such file!" exit else cdbctl update/cdb/sys/update_phy_firmware/${GPORTID}/${GFILENAME} fi fi
UPDATE_EPLD_MAX_TIME_SEC=400 CNT=0 while [ $CNT -lt $UPDATE_EPLD_MAX_TIME_SEC ]; do if [ -f /tmp/glb_load_phy_firmware_done ] ; then break; else CNT=`expr $CNT + 1` fi sleep 1; done
if [ $CNT -eq $UPDATE_EPLD_MAX_TIME_SEC ] ; then echo "Update PHY firmware failed" else echo "Done!" fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to upgrade system phy firmware image.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: This example shows how to update phy firmware: Switch(config)# load phy-firmware 1 /etc/AQR-G2_v3.2.5_ID19866_VER537.cld This example shows how to check phy firmware: Switch(config)# load phy-firmware 1 check

COMMAND.name: split
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the command to split physic port to 10G port or 40G port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Need save configuration and reboot to make command take effect.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to split interface to four 10G port: Switch(config)# split interface eth-0-1 10giga

COMMAND.name: no split
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set the interface to un-split the physic port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Need save configuration and reboot to make command take effect.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to set the split interface to un-split the physic port: Switch(config)# no split interface eth-0-1

COMMAND.name: bypass interface
COMMAND.ACTION: if [ "-1" == ${slotno} ]; then cdbctl update/cdb/sys/port/${ifname1}/bypass/${ifname2}/slot/0 else cdbctl update/cdb/sys/port/${ifname1}/bypass/${ifname2}/slot/${slotno} fi
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the command to set bypass for two port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to set bypass interfaces: Switch(config)# bypass interface eth-0-1 eth-0-2

COMMAND.name: no bypass slot
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use the command to set bypass for two port.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: None
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to set bypass interfaces: Switch(config)# bypass interface eth-0-1 eth-0-2

COMMAND.name: switch
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set an interface to split type.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Need save configuration and reboot to make command take effect.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to set the split interface type: Switch(config)# switch interface eth-0-1 sfp

COMMAND.name: no switch
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set an interface to un-split type.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: Need save configuration and reboot to make command take effect.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to unset the split interface type: Switch(config)# no switch interface eth-0-1

COMMAND.name: schedule reboot at

PARAM.name: ymd
PARAM.help: Specify the date for current year, year range is [2000, 2037]

COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set schedule reboot at a time.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The reboot time could select time with format HH:MM, and optional date with format YYYY/MM/DD or MM/DD/YYYY or MM/DD.
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to set schedule reboot at a time: Switch(config)# schedule reboot at 10:20 2016/6/2
COMMAND.CTCRCMD: schedule reboot delay no schedule reboot

COMMAND.name: schedule reboot delay
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set schedule reboot after a time.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The reboot delay time could select be format HH:MM, or minutes in range of [1,720].
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to set schedule reboot after a time: Switch(config)# schedule reboot delay 100
COMMAND.CTCRCMD: schedule reboot at no schedule reboot

COMMAND.name: no schedule reboot
COMMAND.CTCDESCRIPTION: Use this command to set schedule reboot after a time.
COMMAND.CTCUSAGE: The reboot delay time could select be format HH:MM, or minutes in range of [1,720].
COMMAND.CTCEXAMPLE: The following example shows how to set schedule reboot after a time: Switch(config)# schedule reboot delay 100
COMMAND.CTCRCMD: schedule reboot at no schedule reboot

PARAM.name: VERSION
PARAM.help: Software version,can only include [0-9a-zA-Z.-_] and length range is [1, 29]

COMMAND.name: no sw-ver
COMMAND.help: Cancel the Setting of software version
